@graph.name: How to Import Tag Pages via CSV in OptizenAI

step.name: Prepare CSV File
step.text: Create or format your CSV file with the required columns for tag page data including titles, descriptions, and meta information.

step.name: Access Import Feature
step.text: Navigate to the OptizenAI dashboard and locate the tag pages import functionality in the bulk operations section.

step.name: Upload CSV File
step.text: Select and upload your prepared CSV file using the file upload interface, ensuring proper format validation.

step.name: Review and Confirm
step.text: Preview the import data, verify mapping of columns, and confirm the bulk update operation for your tag pages.

step.name: Monitor Import Progress
step.text: Track the import progress and handle any errors or warnings that may occur during the bulk update process.

mainEntity.name: What CSV format is required for importing tag pages?

acceptedAnswer.text: The CSV file should include columns for tag name, title, meta description, and any custom fields. Watch the video tutorial for the exact format demonstration.

mainEntity.name: How many tag pages can I import at once?

acceptedAnswer.text: OptizenAI supports bulk imports of up to 10,000 tag pages in a single CSV file. For larger stores, consider splitting into multiple imports.

mainEntity.name: What happens if there are errors in my CSV file?

acceptedAnswer.text: The system will validate your CSV and provide detailed error reports. You can fix issues and re-upload. The video shows common error scenarios and solutions.

mainEntity.name: Can I update existing tag pages or only create new ones?

acceptedAnswer.text: The CSV import feature supports both creating new tag pages and updating existing ones. Use the tag identifier column to specify which pages to update.

mainEntity.name: How long does the import process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Import time varies based on file size. Typically, 1,000 tag pages take 2-3 minutes to process. The system provides real-time progress updates.
